TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TreeNodeStyle extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style

Docs.summary: Represents the style of a node in the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> class to represent the style of a node in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control allows you to specify different style characteristics (such as font size and color) for each of the different node types.
The following table lists the node styles that are supported by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> class.
|Node style property|Description| |-------------------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.HoverNodeStyle%2A>|The style settings for a node when the mouse pointer is positioned over it.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.LeafNodeStyle%2A>|The style settings for the leaf nodes.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.NodeStyle%2A>|The default style settings for a node.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.ParentNodeStyle%2A>|The style settings for the parent nodes.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.RootNodeStyle%2A>|The style settings for the root node.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.SelectedNodeStyle%2A>|The style settings for a selected node.|
When you set the node style properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control, they are applied in the following order:
1. <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.NodeStyle%2A>.
2. <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.RootNodeStyle%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.ParentNodeStyle%2A>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.LeafNodeStyle%2A>, depending on the node type.
3. <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.LevelStyles%2A>.
4. <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.SelectedNodeStyle%2A>.
5. <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.HoverNodeStyle%2A>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> class inherits most of its members from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> class. It extends the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> class by providing properties that control the amount of space around the text in a node, as well as the space between adjacent nodes. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.HorizontalPadding%2A> property to control the amount of space to the left and right of the text in a node. Similarly, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.VerticalPadding%2A> property controls the amount of space above and below the text in a node. You can control the amount of spacing between the node that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> is applied to and its adjacent nodes by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.NodeSpacing%2A> property. To control the amount of spacing between a parent node and a child node, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.ChildNodesPadding%2A> property.
For more information about the inherited style settings, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to control the appearance of the parent nodes in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control by setting the style properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object that is returned from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.ParentNodeStyle%2A> property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.%23ctor%2A> constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> class by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> object that is specified by the `bag` parameter.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the amount of space between a parent node and a child node to which the class is applied.
Docs.value: The amount of space, in pixels, that is above and below the child nodes section of a parent node. The default is 0 pixels.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.ChildNodesPadding%2A> property to control the amount of space above and below the child nodes section of the node to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> class is applied. This spacing is inserted between the parent node and its first child node, as well as between its last child node and the next node.
> [!NOTE] > The space after the last child node is not rendered if there are no additional nodes following the last child node, because this would leave an unnecessary gap at the bottom of the control.
To control the amount of space between child nodes, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.NodeSpacing%2A> property.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.ChildNodesPadding%2A> property to specify the space above and below the child nodes section of a parent node.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[TreeNodeStyle#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeNodeStyle/CS/treenodestylecs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[TreeNodeStyle#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeNodeStyle/VB/treenodestylevb.aspx#1)] -->

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void CopyFrom(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style s) cil managed

Docs.summary: Copies the style properties of the specified object into the current object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.CopyFrom%2A> method to duplicate the style properties of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object that calls this method.
> [!NOTE] > All properties in the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object are replaced by the corresponding properties in the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object.
To copy style properties without replacing any values that have already been set, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.MergeWith%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.CopyFrom%2A> method to copy the style properties of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object into the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object that calls this method. Notice that every style property is replaced.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[TreeNodeStyleCopyFrom#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeNodeStyleCopyFrom/CS/treenodestylecopyfromcs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[TreeNodeStyleCopyFrom#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeNodeStyleCopyFrom/VB/treenodestylecopyfromvb.aspx#1)] -->

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the amount of space to the left and right of the text in the node.
Docs.value: The amount of space, in pixels, that is to the left and right of the node's text. The default is 0 pixels.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.HorizontalPadding%2A> property to control the amount of horizontal space around the text of the node to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> is applied. This space is inserted between the left edge of the text and the border of the text area, as well as between the right edge of the text and the border for the text. To control the vertical spacing, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.VerticalPadding%2A> property.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.HorizontalPadding%2A> property to control the horizontal space around the text of a node.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[TreeNodeStyle#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeNodeStyle/CS/treenodestylecs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[TreeNodeStyle#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeNodeStyle/VB/treenodestylevb.aspx#1)] -->

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URL to an image that is displayed next to the node.
Docs.value: The URL to a custom image that is displayed next to the node. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that the property is not set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.ImageUrl%2A> property to specify a custom image for style. This image is displayed next to the node, and it can be in any image-file format (such as .jpg, .gif, .bmp, and so on), as long as the client browser supports that format.
If both the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.ImageUrl%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageUrl%2A> properties are set, the image that is displayed is the one that is specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode.ImageUrl%2A> property.
The value of this property is stored in view state.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void MergeWith(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style s) cil managed

Docs.param: The that will merge with the current node's settings.
Docs.summary: Combines the style properties of the specified object with the style properties of the current object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.MergeWith%2A> method to combine the style properties of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object with the style properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object that this method is called from.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.MergeWith%2A> method joins the style properties by setting each property that is not set in the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object with its corresponding value in the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object. Only properties that have not been set are updated. If a property in the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object is not set, the corresponding property in the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object does not change.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.MergeWith%2A> method to combine the style properties of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object with those of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object that calls this method. Notice that only the unset <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> properties are replaced.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[TreeNodeStyleMergeWith#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeNodeStyleMergeWith/CS/treenodestylemergewithcs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[TreeNodeStyleMergeWith#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeNodeStyleMergeWith/VB/treenodestylemergewithvb.aspx#1)] -->

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the amount of vertical spacing between the node to which the object is applied and its adjacent nodes.
Docs.value: The amount of vertical space, in pixels, between the node to which the is applied and its adjacent nodes at the same level. The default is 0 pixels.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.NodeSpacing%2A> property to control the amount of vertical spacing between a node that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> is applied to and its adjacent nodes at the same level. This space is inserted between the upper edge of the current node and the lower edge of the previous node, as well as between the lower edge of the current node and upper edge of the next node. The upper space is not rendered for the first node in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control, because this would leave an unnecessary gap at the top of the control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.NodeSpacing%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.ChildNodesPadding%2A> properties are applied independently. Whether or not the node is expanded does not affect the node spacing.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.NodeSpacing%2A> property to specify the vertical spacing between a node and its adjacent nodes at the same level in the tree.
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[TreeNodeStyle#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeNodeStyle/CS/treenodestylecs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[TreeNodeStyle#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeNodeStyle/VB/treenodestylevb.aspx#1)] -->

Docs.summary: Returns the object to its original state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.Reset%2A> method to remove any previously defined style elements and reset the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object to its original (that is, default) state.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.Reset%2A> method to return the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object to its default state.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the amount of space above and below the text for a node.
Docs.value: The amount of space, in pixels, above and below a node's text. The default is 0 pixels.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.VerticalPadding%2A> property to control the amount of vertical space around the text of the node to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> class is applied. This space is inserted between the upper edge of the text and the border of the text area, as well as between the lower edge of the text and the border for the text. To control the horizontal spacing, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.HorizontalPadding%2A> property.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle.VerticalPadding%2A> property to specify the vertical space around the text of a node.
